intro: Amphiglottis difformis, commonly known as the variable amphiglottis, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic study.
